Manx: Ta’n Chenn Screeudeyr dy Screeudeyrys Vanninagh Mr. J. R. Bregazzi[1] er ve fo’n skynn yr fer-lhee ec Thie Lhee Nobel. Shimmey chaarjyn dasyn ta jerkal rish fakin eh cowral dy-leah.
English: The veteran journalist of Manx Writing Mr. J. R. Bregazzi has been operated on at Noble’s Hospital. Many are the friends of his who expect (hope) to see him recover soon.
Notes: [1] J. R. Bregazzi] 1875-1955, worked as a journalist for the Isle of Man Times from 1890 – 1950.

Manx: Tra va Canon Stenning loayrt rish ny ynseydee ec yn Ard Scoill Cashtal Rosian yn chiaghtyn shoh chaie, dooyrt eh roo, “Lhisagh shiuish Vanninnee ve voyrnagh ass yn eiraght eu, as dy yannoo dy chooilley nhee oddagh shiu y yannoo er e son.” Va’n Cheshaght Vanninagh aa-vioghit.
English: When Canon Stenning was talking to the students at Castle Rushen Highschool this past week, he said to them, “You Manx should be proud of your heritage, and to do everything you could do for it.” The Manx Society was revived.

Manx: Va’n Ard-jaghin Stockwood yn phreeachoor ec yn feedoo feailley vleeaney as keead jeh’n Keeayl Noo Pheddyr, Connachan.
English: Archdeacon Stockwood was the preacher at the one hundred and twentieth anniversary of the Church of Saint Peter, Onchan.

Manx: Hiauil Mnr. and Bnr. Fred Callow jeh Berkeley, Calif., dy valley er y Franconia lurg quieg meeaghyn ny mast ain er yn Ellan. Hug ad shilley er mooarane jeh nyn mooinjeryn as caarjyn.
English: Mr. and Mrs. Fred Callow of Berkely, California sailed home on the Franconia after five months amongst us on the island. They went to see many of their relatives and friends.

Manx: Bee yn Giense fo-churrym yn Co-chionnal Ceiltagh mairagh, as cha nee er Jeluan shoh cheet.
English: The party organised by the Celtic Congress will be tomorro, and not on the coming Monday.

Manx: She ad shoh ta reiht dy ve nyn ir-oik jeh’n Co-haglym Lught Vanninagh America Twoaieagh ec yn co-haglym ayns Cleveland:
English: These are chosen to be the officials of the North American Manx Association at the gathering in Cleveland:

Manx: Yn Reiltagh-onoroil, A. B. Crookall, Doolish; Fo-Reiltee-Onoroil Mnr. Richard Cain as Rumsaa B. Moore (va’d shoh goit stiagh) Reiltagh Mnr. Henry Mylchreest, Cleveland. fo-reiltagh yn Arrm. J. Partridge, Moliene. Ill. Yn nah fo-reiltagh Mnr. Fred Caveen, Toronto; Yn trass fo-reiltagh Mnr. J. O. Christian. Alhambra. Calif. Scrueedeyr, co-screeuee as co-chloie ’Neen C. M. Mylechraine, Cleveland; Screeudeyr dy argidys as kishteyr Mnr. R. W. Skillicorn, Cleveland; Yn Aa-gheyr jeh’n “Bulletin,” ’Neen Gertrude Cannell. Lakewood, Ohio: Yn skeealeyr co-lught ny mrane. Bnr. Colquitt, Toronto.
English: Honorary President, A. B. Crookall, Douglas; Deputy Honorary President, Mr Richard Cane and Ramsy B. Moore (These were enrolled) President, Mr. Henry Mylchreest, Cleveland; Vice President, the Rev. J. Partridge, Moliene. Ill. Second Vice President Mr. Fred Caveen, Toronto; Third Vice President, Mr. J. O. Christian, Alhambra, Calif. Secretary, correspondent,  and {musical accompanist ??}, Miss C. M. Mylechraine, Cleveland; Financial Secretary and Treasurer, Mr R. W. Skillicorn, Cleveland; The Editor of the “Bulletin”, Miss Gertrude Cannell, Lakewood, Ohio. Representative of the Ladies Auxilliary, Mrs Colquitt, Toronto.
